hero.title: David Cigaran Flores
hero.tagline: Practical training in pentesting and offensive analysis
hero.description: Recently trained at The Bridge and passionate about offensive cybersecurity. Looking for my first professional opportunity to apply my knowledge, learn from experts and add value from day one.

about.title: About Me
about.subtitle: Junior Offensive Security Apprentice
about.paragraph1: My name is David Cigarán Flores, I am 23 years old and I have recently completed my studies in Network Computer Systems Administration (ASIR) and the Cybersecurity bootcamp at The Bridge, where I discovered my interest in offensive security and vulnerability analysis, more specifically in the Red Team field.
about.paragraph2: During my training I have developed a solid foundation in networks, systems and pentesting methodologies, and I continue to expand my knowledge out of personal interest. I consider myself a responsible person, eager to learn and with the ability to quickly adapt to new environments. I enjoy working in teams, sharing ideas and facing technical challenges that allow me to grow.
about.paragraph3: I'm looking for an opportunity to start my career in an environment where I can learn from experts, face real challenges and contribute from day one. My goal is to keep improving little by little, strengthen my skills and become a good professional in the world of offensive cybersecurity.

skill1.title: Basic Pentesting
skill1.description: Web, mobile and network penetration testing. Fuzzing, SQL Injections, Payloads, Brute force among others

skill2.title: Some Tools
skill2.description: Control over Metasploit, Burp Suite, Nmap, Wireshark and testing tools (Red and Blue Team).

skill3.title: Creativity
skill3.description: Source code review and reverse engineering in audits.

skill4.title: Network Reading
skill4.description: Network architecture analysis, intrusion detection through firewall and prevention systems.

skill5.title: Social Engineering
skill5.description: Penetration tests, phishing simulations and CVE exploitation

skill6.title: Cloud Security
skill6.description: AWS knowledge for authorized penetration testing.

project1.title: FinTech Audit
project1.description: Complete security assessment for a FinTech platform, identifying critical vulnerabilities in its API and mobile application.

project2.title: Corporate Infrastructure
project2.description: Internal network pentesting for a Fortune 500 company, discovering attack vectors that allowed lateral movement.

project3.title: Social Engineering
project3.description: Awareness campaign through controlled social engineering tests to evaluate an organization's human resistance.

project4.title: Server Hardening
project4.description: Security reinforcement on critical servers for a government institution, implementing advanced protection measures.

item2.title: Intermediate Degree in Hospitality and Tourism

item3.title: Learning methodologies similar to S.M.R (Microcomputer Systems in Networks)

job1.description: So far I haven't had work experience in this sector, as I've had it in others, but during my internship at ALMI I had to adapt the Basurto Day Center website to requests I received.
job1.responsibility3: Good plugin control for staff and consumer use.
job1.responsibility4: Documentation of changes and previously performed tests.
